text:
Animatronic Trump joins Disney's Hall of Presidents, and Twitter thinks he looks like Jon Voight

CLOSE President Donald Trump becomes the newest member of Disney's Hall of Presidents exhibit December 19. USA TODAY

Disney World is reopening its decades-old Hall of Presidents exhibit with a new addition: President Trump.

Or should we say, Jon Voight?

After a year of renovations, Disney Parks presents its new animatronic Trump on Tuesday in Orlando's Magic Kingdom park. And, of course, Twitter has thoughts on the robotic creation meant to look just like Trump.

Many thought it resembled a certain Oscar winner

Congratulations to John Voight for being elected to Disney's Hall of Presidents. pic.twitter.com/GPvgPTyTC3 — Happy Seanukkah! (@CaptainToney) December 19, 2017

It's weird how the Trump robot at the Hall of Presidents is Trump from an HBO movie five years from now where he's played by Jon Voight pic.twitter.com/7GtizFfELR — Jason Bailey (@jasondashbailey) December 19, 2017

Disney gave the job of Trump in the Hall of Presidents to Jon Voight and I can’t stop laughing. pic.twitter.com/dtu4PnqPv4 — Wil Spillane 🚀 (@2xUEss) December 19, 2017

Someone took note of the other presidents' reaction to the new guy

THIS IS NOT POLITICAL! But how terrifying is the new Donald Trump in Disney's Hall of Presidents?!?! It's hilarious! And look at the reaction shots from the other presidents. 😂 It's like they didn't even try. pic.twitter.com/5PyEbJZMHZ — Brandon Marianne Lee (@BrandonHerFFB) December 19, 2017

And there were those who commented that the character looked 'hideous'

Take the family to Disney's Hall of Presidents for nightmares that will last a lifetime pic.twitter.com/Fs4zSjQae4 — Jessie Lahr (@JessieLahrr) December 19, 2017

If any of you have ever wondered if vegetables can have nightmares, it's safe to say after seeing the Trump robot from Disney's Hall of Presidents, we're about to find out. pic.twitter.com/xq4LUfc1cY — Half An Onion (@HalfOnionInABag) December 19, 2017

A-Plus trolling from Disney, in the Hall of Presidents. Terrible hair? Check. Orange skin? Check. Cheaply tailored suit, and too long tie? Check. Short fingers? Bingo.



However, they did substantially shrink the waistline. pic.twitter.com/b9R6jNx4ME — Eric Schmeltzer (@JustSchmeltzer) December 19, 2017

Whatever you do, don't tell Donald Trump that his Hall of Presidents figure is unspeakably hideous, because he would get very mad about it and that would be super funny. So definitely DON'T do that, ok? #HideousOrangeWaxMonsterpic.twitter.com/Srlf48Av4N — Rex Huppke (@RexHuppke) December 19, 2017

As has been tradition since the early '90s, Trump recorded a speech exclusively for the Hall of Presidents show. This show has been a Disney attraction since a single animated figure of former president Abraham Lincoln was developed for the 1964-65 New York World’s Fair.

President Trump joins Disney's Hall of Presidents after a year of renovations to the exhibit. (Photo: Kent Phillips)
